usecase.name: Collaborative Editing
usecase.scenario: Multiple users work together on a document, leaving comments, mentions, and suggestions.
usecase.preconditions: The document exists and permissions are set for collaboration.
steps: Editor writes the content.
Reviewer leaves comments and suggestions.
Editor reviews and applies suggestions.

testcases.name: Commenting Feature
testcases.description: Verify that a reviewer can successfully add a comment on a block.

testcases.name: Adding Mentions
testcases.description: Verify that a user can mention another team member in a comment.

testcases.name: Apply Suggestions
testcases.description: Verify that the editor can apply a suggestion made by a reviewer.

usecase.name: Rich Text Formatting
usecase.scenario: Users format their text with rich options adding links.
usecase.preconditions: The text block exists in the document.
steps: User selects the text block.
User applies the formatting options
User checks the formatted result.

testcases.name: Linking Text
testcases.description: Verify that a user can add a hyperlink to selected text.

testcases.name: Invalid Markdown Syntax
testcases.description: Verify that incorrect markdown results in failure to apply formatting.

expected.outcome: Formatting not applied due to incorrect markdown syntax.

usecase.name: Organize Content into Columns
usecase.scenario: A user arranges content side-by-side by creating multiple columns on a page.
usecase.preconditions: A Notion page with content exists.
steps: User drags and drops blocks into columns.
Content is organized into multiple columns.

testcases.name: Create Two Columns
testcases.description: Verify that a user can create two columns by dragging and dropping blocks.

testcases.name: Remove Columns
testcases.description: Verify that a user can remove a column by dragging the content back.

usecase.name: Add Headings for Structure
usecase.scenario: The user adds headings to structure the content on a Notion page.
usecase.preconditions: A Notion page with content exists.
steps: User adds H1, H2, and H3 headings for different sections.
Content is structured with headings.

testcases.name: Create Heading
testcases.description: Verify that a user can add an heading to the page.

testcases.name: Header Creation in Incorrect Block
testcases.description: Verify that trying to add a header inside unsupported blocks (e.g., code blocks) fails.

usecase.name: Insert Dividers
usecase.scenario: A user adds dividers to separate sections on a Notion page.
usecase.preconditions: A Notion page with content exists.
steps: User adds a divider between sections.
Sections are visually separated by the divider.

testcases.name: Add Divider
testcases.description: Verify that a user can insert a divider between two sections.

usecase.name: Text Styling and Formatting
usecase.scenario: A user customizes text with different fonts, sizes, colors, and highlights.
usecase.preconditions: A Notion page with editable text exists.
steps: User highlights text.
User applies styling options such as bold, italic, or color from the toolbar.

testcases.name: Bold Text
testcases.description: Verify that a user can apply bold styling to selected text.

testcases.name: Change font
testcases.description: Verify that a user can change font of selected text.

testcases.name: Apply Color
testcases.description: Verify that a user can apply a color to the text.

expected.outcome: Text appears in the chosen color.

usecase.name: Add Icons and Cover Art
usecase.scenario: A user personalizes a page by adding icons and cover images.
usecase.preconditions: A Notion page exists.
steps: User adds or changes the page icon.
User adds or changes the cover image.

testcases.name: Add Page Icon
testcases.description: Verify that a user can successfully add an icon to a page.

expected.outcome: Icon is added to the page.

testcases.name: Change Cover Image
testcases.description: Verify that a user can successfully change the cover image on a page.

usecase.name: Add and Manage Images
usecase.scenario: A user uploads images, arranges them on a page, and resizes them as needed.
usecase.preconditions: A Notion page is open and ready for editing.
steps: User uploads an image to the page.
User arranges and resizes the image.
User adds captions and alt text for the image.

testcases.name: Upload Image
testcases.description: Verify that a user can successfully upload an image to a page.

testcases.name: Resize Image
testcases.description: Verify that a user can resize an uploaded image.

usecase.name: Add and Embed Files
usecase.scenario: A user uploads or embeds files like PDFs or documents into a Notion page.
usecase.preconditions: A Notion page is ready for file uploads.
steps: User uploads a PDF file to the page.
User embeds a file link from an external source.
User arranges the file block on the page.

testcases.name: Upload PDF File
testcases.description: Verify that a user can upload a PDF file to the page.

testcases.name: Embed External File
testcases.description: Verify that a user can embed a file link from an external URL.

usecase.name: Embed and Manage Media
usecase.scenario: A user embeds videos and audio files into a Notion page.
usecase.preconditions: A Notion page is open for editing.
steps: User embeds a video from a streaming service.
User uploads an audio file.
User resizes and aligns the media blocks.

testcases.name: Embed Video
testcases.description: Verify that a user can embed a video from a streaming platform.

testcases.name: Upload Audio File
testcases.description: Verify that a user can upload an audio file and play it in Notion.

testcases.name: Unsupported Media Format
testcases.description: Verify that unsupported audio or video formats fail to play.

expected.outcome: Playback fails, with a message indicating unsupported format.

testcases.name: Exceeds File Size Limit
testcases.description: Verify that uploading a file that exceeds the size limit fails.

expected.outcome: Upload fails with a message about exceeding the file size limit.

usecase.name: Link to Notion Page
usecase.scenario: A user links one Notion page to another within a paragraph or as a block.
usecase.preconditions: Both Notion pages exist and are accessible.
steps: User types '@', '[[' or '+' followed by the page name.
User selects the page from the dropdown.
Link is added in the desired format.

testcases.name: Link Page in Paragraph
testcases.description: Verify that a user can link another Notion page inline within a paragraph.

testcases.name: Link Page as Block
testcases.description: Verify that a user can add a Notion page link as a block.

testcases.name: Broken Link Creation
testcases.description: Verify that trying to create a link to a deleted or non-existent page results in an error.

expected.outcome: Link creation fails with an error about the destination page not existing.

usecase.name: Link to a Web Page
usecase.scenario: A user pastes a URL into Notion and formats it as a mention for easier readability.
usecase.preconditions: A web page link is copied.
steps: User pastes the URL into a Notion page.
User selects 'Paste as mention' to format the link.

testcases.name: Embed Web Link
testcases.description: Verify that a user can embed a web link and format it as a mention.

expected.outcome: Web link embedded as a mention.

usecase.name: View Backlinks
usecase.scenario: A user navigates through backlinks to see which pages link to the current page.
usecase.preconditions: Backlinks exist for the page.
steps: User clicks the 'backlinks' section at the top of the page.
User reviews all linked pages.

testcases.name: View Backlinks
testcases.description: Verify that a user can view all backlinks to the current page.

usecase.name: Create and Manage Wikis
usecase.scenario: A user turns a page into a wiki to organize team knowledge centrally.
usecase.preconditions: A Notion page exists.
steps: User navigates to the page.
User turns the page into a wiki using the page menu.

testcases.name: Create Wiki
testcases.description: Verify that a user can turn a page into a wiki.

usecase.name: Verify Pages
usecase.scenario: A user verifies pages to indicate accuracy and relevance.
usecase.preconditions: The page is part of a wiki and the user is the owner.
steps: User selects the 'Verify' option from the page menu.
User chooses whether to verify indefinitely or for a specific date.

testcases.name: Verify Page
testcases.description: Verify that the page owner can successfully verify a page.

usecase.name: Transfer Content to Another Account
usecase.scenario: A user transfers ownership of content (pages, databases) from one Notion account to another.
usecase.preconditions: Both Notion accounts exist.
steps: User shares the page with the new account.
User grants ownership permissions to the new account.

testcases.name: Transfer Page Ownership
testcases.description: Verify that a user can transfer ownership of a page to another account.

testcases.name: Transfer Between Incompatible Accounts
testcases.description: Verify that transferring content between a free plan and a paid account fails if file size limits are exceeded.

expected.outcome: Transfer fails with a file size limit error.

usecase.name: Duplicate and Delete Content
usecase.scenario: A user duplicates or deletes content on a Notion page.
usecase.preconditions: A Notion page exists with content.
steps: User selects a block of content.
User chooses either 'Duplicate' or 'Delete' from the menu.

testcases.name: Duplicate Block
testcases.description: Verify that a user can duplicate a block of content.

testcases.name: Delete Page
testcases.description: Verify that a user can delete an entire page.

usecase.name: Restore Deleted Content
usecase.scenario: A user restores deleted content from the trash within 30 days.
usecase.preconditions: The content is in the trash and within the restoration window.
steps: User navigates to the trash.
User selects the deleted page to restore.

testcases.name: Restore Deleted Page
testcases.description: Verify that a user can restore a deleted page from the trash.

testcases.name: Restore Deleted Page After Timeout
testcases.description: Verify that restoring a deleted page fails after the allowed restoration time has passed.

expected.outcome: Restore fails due to exceeded restoration period.

usecase.name: Sync Content Across Pages
usecase.scenario: A user syncs content across multiple Notion pages.
usecase.preconditions: Pages must exist, and user must have edit permissions.
steps: User copies the content from a page.
User pastes it on a different page with the 'Paste and sync' option.
Content is now synced across pages.

testcases.name: Sync Content Successfully
testcases.description: Verify that the user can sync content across two pages.

testcases.name: Sync Content Failure - No Permissions
testcases.description: Verify that a user cannot sync content to a page where they don't have permission.

expected.outcome: Sync failed due to insufficient permissions.

usecase.name: Unsync Content
usecase.scenario: A user unsyncs specific content across pages.
usecase.preconditions: Synced blocks exist across multiple pages.
steps: User selects the synced block.
User chooses the 'Unsync' option to remove the sync.

testcases.name: Unsync Specific Block
testcases.description: Verify that a user can unsync a specific copy of the block.

testcases.name: Unsync Failure - Not Original Block
testcases.description: Verify that unsyncing fails when attempting to unsync a block that is not the original.

usecase.name: Create and Edit Code Blocks
usecase.scenario: User creates and edits code blocks within Notion for documentation or sharing code snippets.
usecase.preconditions: User is logged into Notion and has access to a workspace or page.
steps: User navigates to a Notion page and selects the option to add a new block.
User selects the code block option from the available block types.
User types or pastes code into the code block.
User modifies the code block by selecting the language, formatting, or editing the code.

testcases.name: Valid Code Block Creation
testcases.description: Verify that a user can successfully create a code block and input code.

testcases.name: Language Selection
testcases.description: Verify that a user can select a programming language for a code block.

input.code: def add(a, b): return a + b

testcases.name: Empty Code Block
testcases.description: Verify that the system handles an empty code block without any code input.

testcases.name: Edit Existing Code Block
testcases.description: Verify that a user can successfully edit an existing code block.

usecase.name: Create and Display Math Equations in Notion
usecase.scenario: A user creates and formats math equations in Notion using LaTeX syntax.
usecase.preconditions: The user must have access to a Notion page.
steps: User types an equation using the inline math command `$$` or the block equation command `/math`.
The system processes the LaTeX syntax.
The system displays the equation in the correct format.

testcases.name: Valid Inline Equation
testcases.description: Verify that a valid inline math equation is rendered correctly.

testcases.name: Invalid Inline Equation
testcases.description: Verify that the system handles improper LaTeX syntax in inline equations.

expected.outcome: Equation rendering failed due to improper syntax

testcases.name: Valid Block Equation
testcases.description: Verify that a block equation is correctly rendered in Notion.

testcases.name: Invalid Block Equation
testcases.description: Verify that the system handles incorrect LaTeX syntax in block equations.

expected.outcome: Block equation rendering failed due to unrecognized command

usecase.name: Fractions and Advanced Equations
usecase.scenario: A user creates more complex equations, such as fractions and square roots.
usecase.preconditions: The user must have access to a Notion page.
steps: User types a complex equation using LaTeX syntax for fractions or square roots.
The system interprets and formats the input.

testcases.name: Valid Fraction
testcases.description: Verify that a fraction is correctly rendered.

testcases.name: Invalid Fraction
testcases.description: Verify that the system handles missing elements in a fraction.

expected.outcome: Fraction rendering failed due to missing elements
